The pictures of the house do not do it justice.  It feels very secluded and yet is a minute from the main town road and a minute drive to Volcano National Park.  He has beach towels, a cooler, water bottles, head lamps for night walks, cozy blankets, plenty of pots/pans and other cooking supplies and spices you may need.  Mike also has a suggestion box in case we thought of something to make the place better, but we couldn't think of anything!

All in all, great location (short drive to Hilo, we rented jeep and traveled the whole island during our stay.), cozy and secluded house, great supplies, and a generous and helpful host.  Cannot recommend enough!

Mike's cabin is a dream! It's location is close to the Volcanoes National Park, and is nestled in beautiful Volcano jungle/forest. Mike takes care of the cabin and provides every amenity you may need. He's also quite thorough upon guest check-in to ensure you know of every element that he offers. A+, highly recommended!

As others have stated, Mike went above and beyond all expectations. He really cares about your experience when you stay. Wish we could have had an extended stay to check out his library and enjoy the nature more.

Mike thought of every detail and then some.  He clearly put a lot of time and thought into making us feel comfortable and of little details we had not even considered when we booked.  His home is cosy and comfortable.  It has the feel of a little cabin in the rainforest, but has every modern convenience and then some modern technology and little details we had not thought of.  There were trail guides, books, different types of coffee makers and toasters, a bag for shopping at the farmers market, an I-pad that had an app focused on the caldera so we could see when would be a good time to view it...  every time we turned around there was time other little detail that was there fir us to appreciate. He left fresh fruit, milk, orange juice and other breakfast items to get our day started.  Wow!  We really enjoyed our time at Mike's home.

Mike a été un hôte parfait, disponible et discret à la fois.
Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans ce logement très agréable!!!
Mike a été plein d'attentions : des boissons fraiches, yaourts, du lait, etc...
Tout le nécessaire pour le petit-déjeuner ; des guides, des livres sur Hawaii.
Vraiment l'endroit idéal sur Big Island !!

Best airbnb stay I've ever had. Mike's place is beautiful and peaceful, a real oasis and extremely convenient to Volcanoes National Park. He took care of every detail from a stocked kitchen to great information and resources about seeing the sites in the area. A real gem.

Super cozy place to stay on Big Island, very close (7 mn) to the volcano national park - one of the main attraction on big island, you can check the "bubbling" lava crater in the middle of the night!
The location is perfect, the nature surroundings makes you feel you are in the middle of nowhere. Very well (modern) equipped, everything is well-thought and perfectly organized.

We didn't get to meet Mike during our stay at the cabin but he provided all necessary instructions and answers quickly to any question we had!

Mike's place is wonderful. On arrival Mike gave us detailed introduction to the cabin, surrounding area, places to visit and restaurants. Cabin was very clean, so much attention to detail, everything was provided including fruits and breakfast. Cabin is completely secluded, in rain forest-like setting, neighbors can not be seen. Bed is very nice and comfortable, views fantastic. This it the best cabin we have been in. Thanks Mike!

We had the best stay at Mike's AirBnB!! Our biggest regret was only staying for 2 nights. It was an extremely nice place that is meticulously cared for, and Mike gives you detailed instructions on how to maximize your stay in the cottage. You will definitely want to build in time to just hang out and relax in this amazing retreat - sitting in your robe on the sofa, in bed or on the covered porch watching the jungle and listening to the rain was extremely relaxing. Definitely just take all of the suggestions Mike gives when he checks you in, because they are all spot on. Biggest suggestion for staying in Volcano is to grocery shop in a real town before you get there, and buy ingredients for cooking because the kitchen is really well set up and once you are in for the evening you won't want to go out. He has breakfast supplies for you including oatmeal, cereal, milk, pancake mix, orange juice, and chocolate!

If you have the opportunity to stay at Ao Lele, you absolutely should. It's an excellent secluded location extremely convenient to Volcanoes NP, and a great base to explore Hilo, the Mauna Loa slopes, and Mauna Kea. The cabin is stunning with great attention to detail, and Mike's gracious hospitality made our stay so much more enjoyable.

Believe the hype!! Mike's cabin is a magical place, and Mike himself really is a superstar host. He made us feel so, so welcome and all of his recommendations were completely spot-on. Thank you, Mike, for sharing your beautiful home with us and for introducing us to Hawaii with such generosity!!

This was a perfect place to spend some time around the volcano. Very clean, very open, with lots of light and beautiful views of the jungle. Mike is an excellent host. He was very easily reachable and extremely helpful.

We had the most amazing experience staying in Mike’s house among the trees. We stayed for two nights and wish we had the whole week to stay longer. Perfectly located against the fern forest and within just a mile from the National Park. 

We will defiantly be back and next time stay longer. We’ve already told
Many friends they need to stay here when they visit Volcano. Mahalo, Mike.

Mike has taken great care to create a space that is homey and he has thought of pretty much everything. We appreciated having breakfast foods as the house is not near major grocery stores and we used it as a base to explore the whole island. The bed is incredibly comfortable and as others have noted, it rains often here but hearing the rain on the roof and windows is lovely.

Mike is truly an amazing host and the lodge was the perfect getaway! Mike has thought of it all. If there is anything you need, it is exactly where you would expect it to be. The whole place is pristinely clean, the design and decoration is beautiful and inviting, and Mike has a wealth of knowledge to help enhance your trip. Waking up amid the trees and falling asleep to the hush of rain was magical. Don't pass up staying here!

Mike's cabin is an amazing property in a beautiful location. The photos don't even do justice to how amazing it is to wake up in the middle of the forest. It's a unique combination of a rustic cabin with very thoughtful and modern touches that maintain all the charm you'd want for a cabin in the woods.

Mike is wonderful host that gave us a great orientation on the cabin, the surrounding area, and things to do in the area. Very helpful, responsive and knowledgeable.

We were actually a little unlucky with the weather as it rained quite a bit while we were there, but it's such a great place to stay, and there are so many things you can drive to in a short distance, we had a fantastic stay.
Very nice cabin, with a friendly host. Best Airbnb experience so far.

The ideal Airbnb--the best that either of us has ever stayed in. Mike clearly cares about the cabin. It's stylishly designed, with lots of wood and huge windows. The kitchen equipped and came stocked with milk, oj, and other essentials. The location is also great--quiet, forested, and only a few minutes from the national park. Our only regret is not having stayed longer.

We just left Mike's place today and leaving was so hard!  Mike and the cabin were incredible!  If possible arrive before dark as Mike will give you an awesome introduction to the local ecology.  We spent four nights and fixed all our meals at the cabin which has a great little kitchen and spectacular lanai for eating.  We had so much fun in the park and spent all our days there and still didn't do everything we wanted.  Mike has thought of everything and is the best, most thoughtful and accommodating host you could ask for!

Mike's place was such a treat. It is in this beautiful jungle that he keeps up himself and is very private--only a few minutes drive to the volcano national park entrance. We were able to not only explore volcano (the Kilauea lava lake was quite high and lava was visible) but we could time our night-viewing based on checking out the suggested USGS webcam set up on Mike's ipad. We missed viewing the first night because we hit some fog but were able to return the following night to an intensely beautiful milky way/night sky contrasted with the glorious glow of Kilauea. Although Volcano is remote, it is a great set up to check out the green and black sand beaches. Mike is so thoughtful and aware of some of the limitations of the small town, he provided a wonderful little spread so that we might enjoy home-cooked breakfast and teas. He also has an extensive coffee setup for coffee folks as well. We slept very well and there are extra touches like comfortable bedding and thick towels that show Mike's put a lot of thought into folks' stays. It does get chilly in volcano but he's got that covered too; there is rain gear, a little stove that can be lit and small space heater if the temps dip. Do bring layers if you can particularly if it's winter since elevation is >4K feet. Would've stayed longer if we could, don't miss Mike's place!

If you're thinking about staying at Mike's place, honestly, just look no further and book now before someone else does!

Mike's place is unbelievably beautiful. The backyard is literally 20,000 acres of untouched forest. It is incredibly private and secluded, yet is only a 5 minute drive to get dinner/food. For a "rustic" style place, it is absolutely modern and very clean.

Mike takes care of the place so well. Everything is in perfect functioning condition and he obviously cares a lot about the place and your stay in it.

Lastly, Mike has an impeccable attention to detail. He even lit a fire in the wood burning stove because he knew we were coming and it was raining out. The bed and pillows were so comfortable; everything is beautifully matching (e.g. the soap dispenser, toilet flusher, and TP holder are all bronze brushed steel -- he has a knack for design); everything is premium and high quality! By the way, if you're a coffee hound like I am, he has an Aeropress for your use!

We didn't expect it, but staying at Mike's place was one of the highlights of our trip. It will be for you too, trust me!

This luxurious rainforest retreat was by far the best Airbnb rental we've stayed in so far. Mike is a friendly and generous host, providing five-star amenities in an absolutely beautiful home (the photos don't do it justice—it's even better). Highly recommended.

Hard to beat this location and Mike was a great host! Be sure to try the Thai Food truck in town - great food and value. Also take Mike’s advice and visit volcano around 9pm - no crowds and amazing view

What an amazing stay! This absurdly clean cabin is set in a beautiful fern forest very close to the entrance to the volcano park, and although it rained during our entire stay we still had an amazing time cozying up here. Mike was super helpful, even built us a fire while we were out most days we stayed. Other good things:
- Very comfy bed
- Cleanest airbnb I've ever stayed in: you can tell Mike really cares for this place
- Great kitchen amenities, if your style is to stay in and cook like ours
- Fresh/delicious breakfast spread, which Mike restocked during our stay
- Location: great if you're more into lush jungle vibe rather than beachy resort. Even though it was cloudy/rainy most of the time we were there in mid-February, we were so close to the park that the instant the weather cleared we were able to go see "the glow" of Halemaumau: the fog can descend in an instant during the winter (as it did for us) and you have to be close by to catch a good glimpse!

Thanks again for a wonderful cozy cabin stay.

This was our first Airbnb experience and it didn't disappoint. Mike went the exert mile to make sure everything went to plan. He's definitely thought of everything when it comes to the cleanliness of the place, to the coffe/tea and breakfast provisions he has on hand for you, to the plush towels and comfortable bedding. All in all, this was an awesome place to stay. Being in the middle of the rain forest was both relaxing and rejuvenating. You are close enough to local attractions but feel like you're in your own little world. Mike had great recommendations on places to visit and see, which made our time here even better. It's easy to see why so many people have given such positive ratings here. It definitely didn't disappoint! Mahalo!!

This is a very special place. Mike is a great host who goes the extra mile to offer personal touches and tips to make the stay perfect.  The location is great for accessing the park. And the cabin itself is extremely nice and cozy - a perfect place to chill out and relax.  Absolutely recommended!

Absolutely amazing.  Meticulously clean and organized.  Quiet and serene location right next to the Hawaii Volcanoes National Park.  If you want to get away from the crowd this cabin will not disappoint.

I have never stayed in a space that was more thoughtful than Mike's Cabin. From light switches to breakfast options to pillows with variable firmness, every comfort is seen to. The view from the back porch looks right into the thick foliage of Volcano National Park and is chock full of morning birdsongs. Despite the near constant rain we were so happy to be here and relax in this peaceful setting!

You’ll be hard pressed to find a host as thoughtful and good as Mike.  He really works to make sure you have a great experience in Volcano.  His place is super clean, stylish, and 3 minutes from Volcano National Park.  Definitely a great place to spend a few evenings.

We had an absolutely incredible experience at Mike's place. Every detail was thoughtfully placed and described. If you're going to the Big Island, I would HIGHLY recommend staying here. Can't say enough! Thanks, Mike!!

Thinking about staying in the Volcano area? This is a must for anyone looking for a unique experience in their accommodation. Mike’s cabin in the forested area outside the state park is a wonderfully quiet and beautiful location with all of the amenities of modern living.  Its location is perfectly situated for anyone going in to explore the park and not far off if you want to head into Hilo for some other sights and experiences.  
 
Mike is a friendly and gracious host who seems to have thought of everything. His knowledge of the surrounding area, wildlife and the volcano itself will prove invaluable to both the casual and intrepid traveller.
Fantastic home with every touch u would need away from home.

Mike’s place is a rustic and stylish cabin located in the rain forest but only a five minute drive to volcano town and Volcano National Park. 

Mike has built up the cabin with absolutely everything to make a guests stay comfortable and relaxing without exception. 

The bedroom is located on a stunning mezzanine floor with panoramic windows facing the rain forest on both sides. You wake up to the rain Forrest canopy and the birds singing. 

Mike also provides a wide choice of excellent ingredients and food for a perfect breakfast on the veranda. 

I would recommend this to all friends and family visiting Hawaii’s Big Island. 

Ken

The cabin was exceptionally clean and well arranged. The setting is very tranquil. Even with the national park being closed we were never at a loss for things to do. All the necessary items were in the cabin for us to cook dinner from our haul at the farmers market.

This was hands down the best Airbnb I've stayed in, and it's gonna be a tough one to beat! The space is lovely - it's nestled in the woods, beautifully designed, really quiet and serene, and you wake up to the sound of birds chirping every morning.

But what really makes this place special is the amount of thought Mike has put into creating this space. It's extremely well-stocked, the lights in different parts of house are synchronized in a smart-home way, there's an iPad set up with playlist of soothing Hawaiian music and relevant info about the weather and volcanos. 

I so wish we could stay longer. I would highly, highly recommend it to anyone!

Words can’t describe the experience Mike has created at Ao Lele.  My wife and I were new to Air BnB, my expectations were blown away, what a great experience with this superhost.  We even started to hesitate visiting Volcano, following the changes at Kilauea, but Mike helped us ease any concerns pre-trip.  Mike is attentive to every detail, the masterful gardening of this rainforest location, the peaceful lighting that he has fine tuned in the cabin, and the collection of music and books all set the stage for relaxation and clearing your mind of the world, focusing on what matters in life, the journey.  Don’t look any further, you will be very happy here if you want to unwind and have a home base for the Big Island.  Mahalo Mike!

Mike’s cabin was the perfect location for our honeymoon. It was secluded and surrounded by lush rainforest, making it the perfect place to relax after our adventures around the big island. Mike was an excellent host; he greeted us at the cabin upon our arrival and gave us a tour of the place to ensure that we could make ourselves at home. Ao Lele was the perfect rainforest retreat!

Once in a life time experience! The setting of the House is just fantastic. Wether you are lying in bed or sitting on the porch you feel like you are in the Middle of the Jungle. The Most relaxing and beautiful way to Experience nature. Every Detail of The House is just perfect. It’s cozy, lighty and far abraod it really gives you the feeling of being at Home. Not least because of Mike himself. Mike‘s great hospitality and friendly welcome was really overwhelming. He has put so much effort in every little detail, which you will notice with the first Minute you Walk in. We enjoyed every day of our stay and will definitly come back one day. Mahalo Mike!
My husband and I had a wonderful stay!  Mike was an exceptional host.  Would highly recommend!

Looking for a rainforest retreat hideaway ??? You found it. Perfect if you want to be off the grid , hidden and left to your own imagination. There is adequate wi-fi when you need it. I travel for a living so the last thing I want on vaca is a stale hotel room. Flying cloud is a very private and cozy retreat. We picked this place out of many others that were available in the area because we wanted a nature infused seclusion. We have a 5 yr old daughter left back home with grandma and this was exactly what we needed. Easy access to Hilo , Volcano and other points of interest on the island. I proposed to my long time (15yr) side kick during a day trip to the southern most point of US. I’ve been to 42 of the 50 states now and i have to say the big island is one of the most beautiful scenic places I have ever experienced. Stay here you won’t be disappointed. Mike was great upon check in. Extremely thorough and engaging. After the initial orientation we never saw him again. We were left to enjoy all that the big island has to discover.

This cabin and location is beautiful. Every detail is though through very thoroughly by Mike, and his love for the place is really apparent. He even gave us some tips for a nearby sunrise hike which ended up being one of the highlights. The place is sparkling clean, and it’s full of windows so like you are flying in the trees. At night the stars are insanely beautiful and clear, and there are chairs and an outdoor blanket which we enjoyed in the cold. The house is on the last road before wilderness, so it really feels private and quiet. It was a treat to stay here, we hope to be back!

It was just perfect and we felt like home. It was amazing and soo comfy. There was a lot of food in the fridge for us and Mike brang us a Christmascake! It was a wonderful experiance at this cabin! The best airbnb ever. Thanks Mike!

Mike’s cabin really is an amazing place to stay in. We really appreciated the lofted sleeping area and large windows!

Truly a one-of-a-kind gem!

Our stay at this lovely spot in Volcano Village was amazing. The place was secluded, beautiful and clean. The setting was spectacular. And just minutes away from Volcano National Park. Mike gives new meaning to the word “superhost”. He has literally thought of  everything. I would love to stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone. It’s one of my best air bnb experiences to date.

This cabin up in the trees is the best getaway!  The views are amazing and secluded.  The details of the cabin are great and I have never seen an air BnB as clean as this one.  Very nice host greeted us upon arrival and gave us some great tips!  Would highly recommend.

This is a must visit if you're looking for a quiet place away from city life. Here, you sit on the lanai above the tree tops listening to birds sing during the day and watch the stars at night.  Upon arrival you are greeted by the most gracious host, Mike. He's kind, funny, and very knowledgeable about The Big Island.  He gives you the grand tour of the immaculate cabin space - answering any and all questions. We look forward to our return!

Our stay at Mike's place was great, It is super peaceful, and a well though out space inside and out. We enjoyed it as our base camp for exploring Volcano's Natl Park, the farmers market in Volcano and the rest of the Islands beautiful sights. Mike met us and introduced us to the space, he was very kind and thoughtful. Would love to visit again!

Let me just say, THIS is the most perfect Airbnb you will EVER stay at. I doubt that we will find such a gem ever again. The house is gorgeous and sitting on the lanai with a cup of tea or coffee is just breathtaking. This Airbnb ist the cleanest, we‘ve ever stayed at. Everything has it’s place and nothing is missing. You can see that Mike has an eye for detail, not a hook or whatever you could ever wish for is missing. He is very organized and you see that in his house. Yes, he has rules, but those rules will guarantee that you will stay in a perfect vacation home. You won’t find a little bit of dust or water stains on glasses or cutlery. Everything is of highest quality and he even has an Aeropress :) Love, love, love! He sat the bar VERY high, you’ll see.

Great stay! The cabin is a perfectly situated in the rain forest.  it was quiet and tranquil throughout our stay.  Mike was a fantastic host.  He recommended a few activities to do in the nearby area that were real gems.

name: Amazing and Big Apt, Ipanema Beach.
summary: Fantastic apt for 6 people a block from the beach of Ipanema.  Fun, comfort and do everything on foot: bars, restaurants or stroll through the neighborhoods Leblon and Copacabana. In the Carnival, "Banda de Ipanema", show up in front of the building.
space: In the heart of Ipanema, the apartment is very clean, comfort, big espace and amazing view. Perfect for the family or friends.
description: Fantastic apt for 6 people a block from the beach of Ipanema.  Fun, comfort and do everything on foot: bars, restaurants or stroll through the neighborhoods Leblon and Copacabana. In the Carnival, "Banda de Ipanema", show up in front of the building. In the heart of Ipanema, the apartment is very clean, comfort, big espace and amazing view. Perfect for the family or friends. Close to the subw Bus station in front of the building You can do everything in Ipanema on foot.
transit: Close to the subw Bus station in front of the building You can do everything in Ipanema on foot.

name: Small Room w Bathroom Flamengo Rio de Janeiro
summary: Small room! It's a backdoor bedroom that it has its own bathroom for better privacy and also there is an equipped kitchen for you to use. Our apartment is very close to the subway, so in 10min you arrive in Copacabana and 15min in Ipanema.
space: The bedroom is the backdoor bedroom in the apartment, it is very small, it can be comfortably accommodated one person. It has its own bathroom just for the guest's use.
description: Small room! It's a backdoor bedroom that it has its own bathroom for better privacy and also there is an equipped kitchen for you to use. Our apartment is very close to the subway, so in 10min you arrive in Copacabana and 15min in Ipanema. The bedroom is the backdoor bedroom in the apartment, it is very small, it can be comfortably accommodated one person. It has its own bathroom just for the guest's use. A room with a single bed, private bathroom, fan, closet to store clothes, cabins, washing machine, clothesline, kitchen, living room with TV and Netflix. I work at home so I'll stay home often during your stay. I'm a quiet and reserved person but I like to chat sometimes. My neighborhood is quiet, peaceful and calm. There is a 24 hour pharmacy nearby and there are several supermarkets, restaurants and snack bars around, it is a very well located place. The subway is the best way of move in Rio de Janeiro. It's very close to my place. You can go to Copacabana, Ipanema, Barra da Tijuca,
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is quiet, peaceful and calm. There is a 24 hour pharmacy nearby and there are several supermarkets, restaurants and snack bars around, it is a very well located place.
notes: We live my grandmother and I, she is very open minded and cool. But we aren't much of a party. So it wouldn't be a good idea to came home at dawn drunk, vomiting in the bathroom. Oh! I have a cat, he is very docile and rarely mine. This is important because if you are choosing a place to stay keep that in mind.
transit: The subway is the best way of move in Rio de Janeiro. It's very close to my place. You can go to Copacabana, Ipanema, Barra da Tijuca, Floresta da Tijuca ...
access: A room with a single bed, private bathroom, fan, closet to store clothes, cabins, washing machine, clothesline, kitchen, living room with TV and Netflix.

house_rules: - Năo é permitido fumar. Há uma varanda no piso térreo com alguns bancos para fumar. - Por favor, sempre quando cozinhar ou comer alguma coisa, limpe logo depois. - Quando você vai voltar da praia ou trilhas, por favor, lavar os pés na garagem no piso térreo com o chuveiro de mangueira de jardim. - Não é permitido trazer qualquer tipo de amigos para o apartamento ou ter convidados. __________________________________________________ - It's not allowed to smoke. There is a friendly balcony at ground floor with some benchs for smoking.  - Please, always when cook or eat something, clean right after.  - When you'll come back from beach or trails, please wash your feet in the garage at the ground floor with the garden hose shower. - It's not allowed to bring any type of friends to the apartment or having guests.

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

reviews.comments: Fernanda propose deux chambres. J'étais dans la plus petite, une chambre de service. En fait une cabine. Mais c'était les JO, c'était central, je ne voulais pas payer cher... Et j'avais ma propre salle demain

name: UWS Brownstone Near Central Park
summary: This spacious one bedroom apartment has a bonus space with two extra beds as well as a fold out sofa.  Close to the park, the subway, museums and restaurants.  This apartment is the perfect quiet getaway in the middle of Manhattan.
space: This charming one-bedroom apartment in a landmark brownstone townhouse in the Upper West Side area of Manhattan has high-ceilings, a fireplace and two planted, south-facing balconies overlooking a beautiful garden.  (The balcony off of the living room is about 5" X 8" and has a small table and two chairs where two people can have a nice meal.  The balcony off of the bedroom is about 5" X 14' and there is a chaise longue and a sitting chair, along with two side tables.  Both have outdoor lights, overlook a nice garden, and have plantings.)   There is a queen-sized bed in the private bedroom with closing door. There is also a very high quality full sized sofa bed in the living room.  This beautiful home is on an historic tree-lined block, between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue, near major museums, shopping, and subways.   The owner prefers to accommodate two adults.  Because of the circumstances, only guests who are comfortable being reasonably quiet are encouraged to stay.    Thi
description: This spacious one bedroom apartment has a bonus space with two extra beds as well as a fold out sofa.  Close to the park, the subway, museums and restaurants.  This apartment is the perfect quiet getaway in the middle of Manhattan. This charming one-bedroom apartment in a landmark brownstone townhouse in the Upper West Side area of Manhattan has high-ceilings, a fireplace and two planted, south-facing balconies overlooking a beautiful garden.  (The balcony off of the living room is about 5" X 8" and has a small table and two chairs where two people can have a nice meal.  The balcony off of the bedroom is about 5" X 14' and there is a chaise longue and a sitting chair, along with two side tables.  Both have outdoor lights, overlook a nice garden, and have plantings.)   There is a queen-sized bed in the private bedroom with closing door. There is also a very high quality full sized sofa bed in the living room.  This beautiful home is on an historic tree-lined block, between Central Park
transit: There is a subway stop one block away and when you come back there is an exit from the subway just yards away from our building on 87th.  Taxis are usually plentiful on Central Park West.  Some of the best museums in the world are a short walk directly across Central Park.  Of course Uber and Lyft are also easy to get.
access: The entire apartment including the balconies is at your disposal.  There is a laundry in the basement that uses quarters ($1.50/load).
interaction: We are not usually around and you'll have the place to yourselves.  We are available by phone and email all the time if you ever have questions or concerns.
house_rules: All the facilities are included ( cleaning , towels , bed linen , heating , WIFI) . Limited to two adult guests only.

host.host_about: We live in San Francisco and spend time in New York as well.  We also have another place in Northern California in the country we spend time at.  I'm a private pilot and Paul is quite an accomplished ceramicist, though he does non-profit management consulting by profession. I run a retreat center ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) and am a computer consultant some of the time and real estate investor other times.  We have a cat who stays at our house here in San Francisco when we travel.  She is very, very affectionate and easy to care for.

reviews.comments: We stayed in the brownstone for 4 nights and had a lovely time.  The apartment was spacious enough for us (a family of four) and the location was amazing.  You are steps to Central Park and to the 86th subway.  There are wonderful restaurants and shopping nearby if you need that but the small kitchen is fine for quick snacks and breakfast.  It was especially nice to sit on the little patio to eat my toast and tea and even with the NYC humming around you it is lovely to have an outdoor space.  Chas answered all my many questions with great patience and care...he really wanted us to have a wonderful time and went beyond the call of duty by even sending us links to good places to watch big soccer matches.  The apartment was clean when we arrived and had the basic things we needed such as towels and extra sheets.  While not the cheapest option on BNB it gave us all a wonderful bed to sleep in, space to spread out in when needed, and a fantastic location!  We even found street parking for the full 5 days!  Picking up the keys was a breeze and we left a few basic things for the next guests to enjoy from the corner store.   It is a gorgeous street to stay on and felt very safe. Thank you so much Chas!  We hope to return one day soon.

Our stay in New York at this apartment was vastly superior to staying at a hotel.  The location is perfect particularly for those wanting access to Central Park and the museum mile (Guggenheim etc) but it was also a revelation to explore that end of Broadway.  The apartment is lovely and has everything.  We especially appreciated the study nook and ability to use our laptop with wifi access and the well equipped kitchen for easy prep for meals (and deli close by makes it so easy to stock up).  The lounge, bedroom and bathroom are all in good, comfortable condition.  The little balconies and view of the courtyard topped it off.  A great experience and thoroughly recommend.

After a small glitch with the house keys, which was straightened out straight away, our stay was perfect. The apartment is lovely, in a great neighborhood and right by the subway. Even my husband. who is very picky, gave it a two thumbs up ! Our hosts were attentive and gracious over the emails and the whole thing was easy and pleasant. We'd definitaly book again.

It's hard to imagine a more authentic and enjoyable NYC experience than the one we had staying in this UWS apartment. There are so many details -- from the art on the walls to the spices in the kitchen -- that make it feel like a home away from home. The apartment is small but imminently comfortable with high ceilings and patios that make it feel spacious. The unit is off the street (on a courtyard)  so it was very quiet (that  and the comfortable bed made for great nights of sleeping). It's a beautiful street, just off Central Park and just around the corner from the subway. There are abundant restaurants within a 5 minute walk and the best coffee in NY (Joe's) is only about two blocks away. Chas was a great host who was quick to answer all our questions and make our stay as enjoyable as possible. We had our two sons with us (ages 10 and 12) and the living arrangements were ideal for a family our size. Thanks, Chas!

We just spent Christmas week at the apartment with our two daughters (aged 2.5 and 1). The space was well stocked and furnished and the location was perfect. It's not a huge apartment but the lofted ceilings give it a nice, open feel. Central Park, the subway, a convenience store, a wine store, and Starbucks are all within a block or two. When I first booked the reservation I was unsure about the process to get the keys, but it turns out I had no reason to be worried whatsoever. It was very easy and worked out well. Chas answered questions promptly and is a great host. We hope to be back soon!

A great experience - Chas was a good communicator so picking up the key went exactly as planned (a good thing for a first timer!), the apartment was just what we needed and the location (and quiet street) really were fabulous.

I don't think we could of asked for the most perfect spot to stay at while visiting NYC. This home is close to everything we wanted to experience while being in the city.... the park, museums, great places to eat at, major subway lines to take you to midtown and lower Manhattan, etc, etc,.  The apartment was so nice, quiet, comfortable, and cool to come back to after being out and about ( we had a couple of days during our stay where it was very warm ) and that was a plus !  Both Paul and Chas were quickly responsive and accommodating to any questions or needs we had. All in all, if you really want to get a great NYC experience, this beautiful UWS retreat is the way to go.  Thank you Chas and Paul !!

My Mum and I recently spent 11 nights at Chas' Upper West Side apartment. We had not used AirBnB before, but the whole process ran very smoothly. Both Chas and Paul were quick at answering emails and provided us with plenty of information re local grocery shops etc. The pick-up of the keys was also very simple. 
The apartment is in a great location, half a block from Central Park and close to several subway lines. Only up one flight of stairs, which was good because there are no lifts! 
The apartment was very well equipped with everything you need for a stay away from home - bedding, towels, full kitchen etc. It was a bit smaller than it appears in the photos and could do with a lick of paint, but was very clean and had plenty of storage. Also, keep in mind that the beds in the loft may provide a bit of a problem for some guests - definitely best for kids. 
Overall, we had a great time at Chas' apartment and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to visit New York!
We had a great time in the apartment! Location was great with just steps to Central Park and the subway right around the corner. Would stay here again for sure! Thanks!

Our stay in the apartment on 87th St was really wonderful. The neighborhood was cosy and felt safe, the subway was only steps away and it was close both to the park and to the shops and restaurants on Amsterdam and Broadway. It couldn't have been better. The apartment itself was nice and roomy for being in New York, and had everything we needed. The kitchen was small but well equipped and the beds were comfortable. Chas was very helpful and answered all our questions very quickly. Overall, it was a really wonderful stay!

We're grateful to Chas and Paul being were flexible and accommodating with our arrival / departure times and our queries over the first day or so.  
The description and pictures were accurate and the apartment was well-maintained and very neat and clean.  The mezzanine floor is best suited for storage or sleeping arrangements for children or understanding teens or adults.
The upper West Side felt very safe at all times and the apartment was on the same block for the subway stops for B and C trains and a short walk to restaurants / cafes on Columbus and Amsterdam.  Overall, the apartment offered a genuine feeling of how it would be to live as a New Yorker, rather than a hotel tourist.  Highly recommended.
The reservation was canceled 46 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We felt like home during a wonderful week in October. I have been to NY repeatedly and I was always reluctant to return because of the hotels which I didn't like at all. Now there is a reason to come back again: the cozy apartment, the lovely neighborhood, close to Central Park and subway made our stay just perfect. Thank you very much!
Clean well maintained apartment in an excellent location. Good restaurants close by and subway one block away.
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

The apartment was perfect for my first visit to New York and as a first-time Airbnb user. Chas was always quick to respond and very helpful. The images of the apartment are accurate and the Upper West Side area was great - close to Central Park, a heap of stores and restaurants, away from the noise. The first floor does have a low ceiling which is ideal for smaller children. The apartment was always warm so it was a treat to come back home after a long day out in the cold. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Mil gracias Chas por dejarnos compartir tu hermoso apto. Nos hemos sentido como en casa. Muy comodo y confortable, con todo lo necesario para sentirse a gusto. A pesar de las extremas temperaturas que nos tocaron, la calefaccion estuvo excelente. Y una mension especial a la ubicacion, a pasos del Central Park y al Subway. Esta demas decir que volveremos siempre y cuando no permitan. Nos sentimos unos perfectos Neoyorquinos!!!!

The apartment was exactly how we imagined it to be: cosy, but spacious by New York standards. The heating is excellent and the building is very quiet with almost no ambient noise whatsoever; again, a rarity in New York. The apartment is located in a beautiful street lined with old Brownstones, so would be perfect for those who prefer a genteel New York neighbourhood rather than an urban, grungy one. It is located a few minutes' walk from the subway and a block back from Central Park. Great spot, and the owners were easy to arrange accommodation with.
Our host was wonderful.  Everything was easy, the apartment was beautiful and the location is perfect.  We LOVED it.
A perfect spot 1 minute walk to Central Park and underground!! Highly recommended!! The location is very quite!!

We loved this neighborhood and the proximity to the park. Pictures and descriptions of this charming apartment were accurate and we found the accommodations very comfortable. An issue we had with an access key was solved successfully and our host (even though traveling himself) was prompt with communications. We hope to return one day and would happily recommend this listing.

Helpful host,Great location!But it is old building.....something is not satisfied .
Mice share the room for example!
superb location - safe, convenient, quiet - and we were very comfortable in the apartment

Paul's place is in such a great location, so close to the subway, shops, cafes and restaurants. Along with a only being a couple of blocks away from the American Museum of Natural History and a short and beautiful walk through Central Park to The Met and the Guggenheim. 
The apartment is as pictured, it's tidy and clean and very comfortable. I couldn't hear any street noise and slept well. 
There's a hairdryer which made my day as well :D
Paul was very responsive to questions I had, and went out of his way to make sure check in was easy. 
Highly recommended.

Paul's home is sweet and cozy and warm. It is in a quiet residential building on a lovely tree lined lock on the upper west side; close to the subway and next to  Central Park. If you walk to Columbus Avenue, there are stores and restaurants and also on Amsterdam Avenue and Broadway. Its a great place to stay if you want to enjoy NYC and then come back to a quiet and tranquil retreat. Our host was very communicate regarding the arrangements for acquiring the apartment keys and any questions we had were answered promptly. There is a laundry in the basement of the building which makes it easy to wash and dry your clothes. The Museum of Natural History is close by and so is the NY Historical Society and of course beautiful Central Park and one can walk towards the  Henry Hudson River to Riverside Park.  Overall a lovely and positive experience. Thank you!
Paul's place is lovely and true to pictures! It's right next to the subway which is very convenient, and the street is very quiet. We very much enjoyed our time here.
The host canceled this reservation 98 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
非常有家庭感的住宿体验,主人很有情调,出门就是中央公园也有地铁,但是房东的钥匙需要寄来寄去有点麻烦

Paul and Chas' flat is very warm and welcoming, and perfect for a couple. It is beautifully located right next to Central Park, as well as roads like Columbus, which has ample coffee shops, bars and restaurants. It is also very close to the subway station for easy exploring of other districts like Greenwich Village and Brooklyn. We were able to walk to lower Manhattan (Times Sq, Rockerfella Centre etc). The flat was the perfect cosy place to come back to and watch the snow. We felt very safe and everyone we met in the area was incredibly friendly, particularly Paul and Chas' friend Gail who assisted us with keys and NYC recommendations! We would happily recommend this apartment to any future visitors - we are very sad to leave!
Paul's apartment was as it appeared to be in the pics. Loved having the additional loft space and we felt very safe in the area.

Great little apartment in quiet neighbourhood. Barely any traffic noise was heard but the heater was extremely loud and kept us awake at night (centrally controlled).
The apartment is very close to lots of great restaurants on Columbus, Amsterdam and Broadway. 
Thank you to Chas and his helpers for the excellent communication and great stay!

Chas's apartment on the Upper West Side was like staying at a home away from home. Located close to Central Park, and many restaurants just a few blocks over.  Very happy to be so close to the subway which made going downtown very easy. 

We were a couple and extra adult, who slept in the loft. It is a loft (can't stand up) but nice to sleep on a real mattress,  as opposed to fold out sofas like much of the value for money accommodation in New York. 

Chas was easy to communicate with, and very accommodating as we were able to arrange for us to drop our bags off early before check in so that we could head off and explore. Would stay again in the future, as such great value for money (and doesn't feel like your staying a shoe box, like most of NYC). Would be perfect for families. Thanks!
A lovely apartment on a quiet street full of brownstones.  Close to the 86th subway stop and a few steps to Central Park.  Comfortable and tastefully decorated.  We loved it and hope to return.

Nous sommes un couple retraité ,qui avons passé 8 jours à New York dans cet appartement ,avec notre petite-fille de 25 ans qui travaille pendant un an près de New York.
Elle dormait dans la mezzanine à plafond très bas (ce qui ne l'a pas dérangé).
appartement très agréable ,quoique un peu  sombre ,et très bien placé ( métro et Central Park).

This is a great spot - fantastic subway access, great restaurants a few blocks away and Central Park practically across the street.  The apartment is charming, welcoming and easy.  Can't imagine a better way to visit New York.

Great place to stay! Loved the location. Subway one block away. You can see Central Park when you walk out the front door. Riverside park is just a few blocks in the other direction. 
UWS is a great place to stay in the city. I've stayed in UES and Harlem before. UWS and UES is about the same, but this location at UWS is quieter. 

For great restaurants just walk on over to Columbus Av, Amsterdam Av or Broadway and your set. 

The apartment: It was nice, big and homely. The bushes by the little veranda could use some trimming but we didn't have time to use it anyway. 
AC is really good. You leave it off when you go out. Put it on when you get back in and it's nice, and cool in minutes. 
As indicated, the ceiling in the loft is low. You can't stand up straight. But there's plenty of room up there. 

Communicating with Chas was easy. He always answered my questions quickly. 

Overall a great experience!

Just spent a wonderful week at Chas's apartment and truly had a wonderful time.  The apartment looks as it appears in the pictures and has all the amenities you would want to have a comfortable stay.  The location is fantastic as the street is quiet, there is a subway stop right at your door and you are steps away from all sorts of great food and entertainment.  You could spend hours just exploring Central Park, which is right next door.  Thank you Chas for providing a home away from home in the best city in the world.

Excelente ubicación, a metros del central park y de avenidas como Broadway. Facil acceso al subterráneo. Comodo para dos personas pero caben 3 bien. Cocina completa!
